citation.article-title: Cellulomonas phragmiteti sp. nov., a cellulolytic bacterium isolated from reed (Phragmites australis) periphyton in a shallow soda pond
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Cellulomonas phragmiteti sp. nov.
Cellulomonas phragmiteti (phrag.mi′te.ti. N.L. gen. n. phragmiteti of Phragmitetum, referring to plant association Scirpo–Phragmitetum, the habitat from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-stain-positive, facultatively anaerobic, motile rods.
Colonies on King’s B agar plates are, smooth, yellow to pale orange and circular within 3 days at 25 °C.
Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
Growth occurs at 15–37 °C, at pH 7.0–9.0 and in the presence of 2.0–7.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Optimum growth occurs at 25 °C, at pH 8.0 and with 5.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth occurs under anaerobic conditions on King’s B agar.

Utilizes l-arabinose, d-xylose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, starch, glycogen and turanose as sole carbon source, but not glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, d-ribose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, lactose, inulin, raffinose, xylitol, gentiobiose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate or potassium 5-ketogluconate.
Hydrolyses casein, gelatin, aesculin and Tween 80.
Cellulase is produced.
Does not produce indole from tryptophan or hydrogen sulphide from cysteine.
Positive in the methyl-red test but negative for the Voges–Proskauer reaction.
Negative for nitrate reduction.
Positive for urease but negative for phosphatase.
The peptidoglycan is of type A4β (l-Orn–d-Asp).
MK-9(H4) is the predominant menaquinone.
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 1 (Table 2).
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 74.8 mol%.
Fatty acid profiles of strain KB23T and Cellulomonas flavigena DSM 20109T
Data are from the present study.
Values are percentages of the total fatty acids.
The type strain, KB23T ( = DSM 22512T = NCAIM B002303T), was isolated from Phragmites australis-associated biofilm originating from a soda pond in Kiskunság National Park, Hungary.
